item.title: Cause parking problems within the beehive close community, 2nd October
item.description:
Causing too much problems with parking , makes the area look trampy , it's abandoned and we are starting to lose faith in are council to deal with such matters please please come and get it we need every parking spot available

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beehive Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Disgusting language aimed at me, 2nd October
item.description:
While walking through Kelsey Park with my grandson. The park team were cutting some over hanging branches. They kindly let me past with my grandson only for one with an Eastern European accent to call out “see you later, masturbator” one of the team did apologise but surely this is not acceptable behaviour from your staff. Especially since I had my grandson with me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cyclists in Green Park, 2nd October
item.description:
The path that runs down the side of Green Park (parallel to St James Street) is supposed to be pedestrian only with no cycling allowed. Perhaps some better signage or enforcement is required as cyclists frequently use it, in many cases at unsafe speeds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Walk, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree over handing my garden, 2nd October
item.description:
I reported this months ago u then passed it onto network rail they came and cut the tree on there property the other side of fence but the picture I sent of the tree is not on there property it’s down to Bexley council to sort out I was shown maps by them to confirm this

item.title: Using the street as a car workshop, 2nd October
item.description:
This vehicle has now moved and the number plates have been removed s3-5 of the Clean Neighborhoods and Environment Act 2005 makes it an offense to: It is now possible to take action against nuisance caused by individuals repairing vehicles on the street as a business. Using the street as a car workshop. In the UK, it is illegal to carry out significant vehicle repairs on a public highway, and it is a criminal offense to have a vehicle on a public road without number plates. Doing so could lead to large fines, points on a driving license, and the vehicle being removed by the authorities. Offense of removing number plates Driving or parking a vehicle on a public road without a number plate is a serious offense in the UK, with fines of up to £1,000. For illegal business activity: If the activity appears to be an illegal business operating on the street, you can report it to your local council. They can investigate whether repairs are being conducted for "gain or reward" and issue a fine.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penarth Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Orangery Lane - flytiping outside Elkins Construction site, 2nd October
item.description:
Despite our site manager reporting the fly-tipping incident3 times, no remedial action has been taken. The waste remains at the site entrance, creating a serious health and safety hazard. It has also begun attracting wild animals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orangery Lane, Well Hall, London

item.title: Issue with what looks like a broken pipe underground. This was multiple times reported to Thames Water over the past 2 months (first report mid-August). Still nobody came to fix this. Water comes out from underground more and more every day and holes on the tarmac are starting form., 2nd October
item.description:
